meanings.sent1: The narraters in the play made the audience laugh with their funny voices.
meanings.sent2: The children gathered around the campfire, eager to listen to the narraters share their tales.
meanings.sent3: The narraters at the library event had everyone on the edge of their seats with their thrilling stories.
meanings.sent4: Her words painted a vivid picture, turning her into one of the greatest narraters of all time.
meanings.sent5: The narraters' voices echoed through the room, bringing the story to life for all to hear.

meanings.definition: The act of telling a story.
meanings.sent1: She narraters her adventures to her friends every weekend.
meanings.sent2: The author carefully narraters the events leading up to the climax of the novel.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to narraters its daring escape from the top shelf of the bookcase.
meanings.sent4: His eyes narraters a tale of heartbreak and loss, even though his lips remained sealed.
meanings.sent5: The wind whispered through the trees, as if trying to narraters a secret to those who would listen.
